snippet: President Obama acknowledged he was slow to respond to public fears, but said sending ground forces back to the Middle East could result in 100 American deaths every month.
abstract: Pres Obama asserts 100 soldiers could die monthly if American ground forces are deployed to Middle East; apologizes for not more rapidly quelling public's fears after terrorist attacks in America and abroad; defends cautious escalation of campaign against global terrorism, especially from criticism by Republican presidential candidates.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and GARDINER HARRIS
byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting from Las Vegas.

lead_paragraph: President Obama acknowledged he was slow to respond to public fears, but said sending ground forces back to the Middle East could result in 100 American deaths every month.

headline.main: Under Fire From G.O.P., Obama Defends Response to Terror Attacks
headline.print_headline: Assailed by G.O.P., Obama Defends His Response to Terror Attacks

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
